content:
Diagnosis:		Vulval squamous cell carcinoma, p16 positive

Stage:		T2N2M0 with bilateral inguinal nodal involvement

Treatment:		Concurrent chemoradiotherapy commenced 15 Jan 2024
		Cisplatin 40mg/m2 weekly with IMRT 60Gy/30#

Current Status:	Week 4 of treatment

[redacted name] attended for week 4 review of concurrent chemoradiotherapy. Treatment has been well tolerated overall with grade 2 radiation dermatitis requiring regular Flamazine application. Blood parameters remain stable with latest creatinine 82, neutrophils 2.1. No ototoxicity reported. Performance status remains 1. Examination shows expected radiation changes but no evidence of disease progression. Latest weekly cisplatin proceeded at full dose.

The plan is to continue with concurrent chemoradiotherapy as scheduled. Radiotherapy is proceeding according to protocol with good compliance. We will review again next week with blood tests. Acute oncology team aware in case of complications.

cancer_timeline.value: Started concurrent chemoradiotherapy with weekly cisplatin 40mg/m2

patient_facts.value: Expected radiation changes, no evidence of disease progression

status_updates.value: Vulval SCC with nodal involvement. Week 4 of concurrent chemoradiotherapy with good tolerance and stable disease.
Continuing weekly cisplatin at full dose with concurrent radiotherapy
